committees.name: Arts
committees.description:
The Arts Committee is at the forefront of creatively connecting and engaging our community in a variety of ways. Currently, our members can embark on projects such as our birthday banners that are posted in the Yurt; help host events like “Painting with a Twist” and other collabs; create posters, designs, and any artistic needs for other committees; and oversee McGallery registration and displays.

If you’re looking for a way to flourish with your artistic skills, then this is the place for you—beyond just sharing what you love, you’ll have the chance to learn from members about many other art forms. Whether it’s music, dance, painting, theater, or more, we’re always open to bring more creativity to Murt! If you don’t see your chosen artistic passion in our current projects, we’re always happy to help new projects grow. :)

committees.name: Alumni
committees.description: Wondering how McMurtry alumni keep in touch with the best college at Rice? Look no further than the Alumni Committee. This committee sends out a newsletter each semester during the school year to all McMurtry alumni, updating them on what's going on at Rice and McMurtry. They also are involved with events at McMurtry that include alumni such as during Homecoming, McScottish Night, and Beer Bike! Their goals are to reach out to the young, enthusiastic classes that just graduated our college and get them involved in making McMurtry's culture amazing. The Alumni Committee also focuses on connecting current students at McMurtry with alumni through networking events, professional panels (“Murt Talks”), and coffee chats. The committee also takes part in development and fundraising efforts for McMurtry College.

committees.name: Associates
committees.description:
Welcome to one of the most fun and rewarding committees at Murt!!

The Associates Committee serves as a liaison between McMurtry's students and associates. McMurtry associates are Rice faculty, staff, and alumni as well as adult professionals in the Houston area who are associated with Rice. They serve as mentors, friends, academic advisors, and general resources for students.

Associates Committee hosts intellectual events, monthly lunches, study breaks, holiday events, and a formal, themed Associates' Night each semester. The committee also organizes O-Week group lunches with associates, as well as a pre-O-Week reception and dinner.

committees.name: Social Media and History
committees.description: The Social Media and History committee is important for preserving the traditions, events, and faces of McMurtry. While we are here to document McMurtry history, we are also here to capture the lives of all Murts to remember their Rice and McMurtry experience. We are also responsible for the McMurtry Instagram and Facebook pages. We take on one special project a year such as a collage, video, scrapbook, etc. in order to commemorate the past school year. This year, we hope to make an interactive McMurtry scrapbook. No prior experience with photography or equipment necessary! This is a really fun and easy way to get more involved with McMurtry history, events, and earn your service hours. If you are interested in taking pictures, social media, and connecting with McMurtry, this is the committee for you. :)

committees.name: Murtchandise
committees.description:
Do you love creativity? Do you love merchandise? Do you love logistics? If so, the Murtch committee is perfect for you! The Murtch committee is in charge of facilitating design submissions and the ordering of merch for the college. Murtch holds sales of new merch and also sometimes retro merch from the vault.

Specifically, heads will send out forms where people can submit designs for various items of murtch. Heads and the committee members will collaborate to select merch items (such as hats, shirts, stickers, etc.) and plan logistics for order forms and contact vendors. Committee heads will also keep track of finances such as using the Murt budget to subsidize and collecting payment for sales.

committees.name: Sports
committees.description: Sports! Do you like attending, watching, or playing in sporting events? Do you wish more people attended Rice sporting events? The sports committee is all about being passionate about your Rice Owls’ sports teams, as well as McMurtry Intramural Sports teams. We help plan tailgates for Rice athletic events, such as Rice Football games, and popular intramural sports events, including women’s Powder Puff football. In addition, we also help plan events related to national sporting events, such as the Super Bowl Party or March Madness Bracket competition. Come help make sure that Rice Fight Never Dies (#RFND) and that MFYF are both in the stands and in all levels of competition!

committees.name: Traditions
committees.description:
Hey Murt!! Want to enhance Murt culture for years to come?? Join Traditions! Traditions throws a whole host of events throughout the year, such as McScottish Night, Murt-O-Ween, Murty Holidays, the Super Bowl Watch Party, and McSassins!

If you have any idea of how to improve upon an existing tradition or create a new one, we strongly encourage you to apply! Members have the autonomy to propose, implement, or veto any event, no matter how silly or small! Spellcasting during McScottish Week and holiday decorating Murt commons are a couple of examples of new things that were added last year, so you can really have fun with it!

Traditions can really set the tone for McMurtry's spirit and morale, and allow you to create the environment and activities you would like to participate in within the college. We are such a young college, and there is so much you can do to shape the culture for years to come!

committees.name: Amenities
committees.description: Do you think some of our spaces look meh? Do you like interior design? Do you think there’s something the college really needs? If you do, you should totally join us in Amenities! We get a hugeeee amount of budget from Housing & Dining (like thousands) to spend on making McMurtry look better and be more usable for all Murts. You basically get to play Sims 4 in real life, with money that’s not yours! We did a lot of great work last year, including adding new furniture, an *air hockey table*, repainting the Game Room, and more kitchen machines, tools, and utensils. We also make sure all of our spaces stay in top shape throughout the year and help set up the tech for committees that need speakers, mics, and projectors. This is your chance to have a real, visible impact on how Murt is as a college, and no experience is required to join and contribute your ideas. JOIN US!!!

committees.name: Culinary
committees.description: The fastest way to reach a person’s heart is through their stomach, and we cater to the taste buds of all Murts! The Culinary Committee hosts fun food related events, such as Sunday Sundaes! Our creative members are always coming up with delicious creations that bring Murts together. We also maintain the kitchens at McMurtry in collaboration with the Amenities Committee. Other collaborations we do are helping out with any committee when there is a food need, notably at cultural FITQs and class bonding events. We also provide cookies for every Baker 13 defense. No cooking experience is necessary, just fun ideas. If you love food, either cooking or eating, join us!

committees.name: Website
committees.description: Think our website looks like trash? Want some real experience with web development and web design? Join the Website committee! This is your chance to help with our online presence (which is not great right now) and get easy resume material if you’re a COMP major. Our current goals are to finish updating the website’s information (some of which has barely been updated over the last TWO YEARS) and do a major revamp of the look and feel of our website from the ground up. This committee is being reborn from the dead for a reason, and over the last spring semester, we started our plans for a major website upgrade, including more pictures of Murts, more Murt pride, and better website navigation. While having previous experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ReactJS, or NextJS is great, it’s not necessary AT ALL to join us. If you’re great at art and want to use your skills to make our website look nicer, you would be extremely helpful, too. JOIN NOW!

committees.name: Environmental
committees.description: Are you passionate about sustainability? Do you love all things Murt? Then join the Environmental committee where we combine the two! We plan Sustainable Sunday Sundaes (now a Murt tradition), Environmental FITQs, trips to the Rice Village Farmer’s Market, and more! Our committee members will join us shopping at Trader Joe’s, run booths at the campus-wide annual Sustainability Fair, and help us plan all of the sustainability events at McMurtry. Come share your ideas with us and help us continue the tradition of McMurtry being the most sustainable college on campus.

committees.name: McMurtry Innovation Space (MIS)
committees.description:
Like to build, create, or innovate? The MIS is your place! We are responsible for making the McMurtry Innovation Space an awesome place for anyone at Rice to go to for all things creative. We offer a ton of things, including woodworking tools (with a miter saw and multiple other types of saws), 3D printing, CAD software (with 2 powerful computers), electronics, a whiteboard wall, and a projector! This is also the home base for our Arts Committee, and we have a ton of supplies to fit your artsy needs as well.

Fun fact: NO other college has anything like this! Join us to help us not only make the space cooler, but also to help host workshops and events for the Murt (and Rice) community that teach people about different aspects of engineering or art! We would love to hear your thoughts and work with your ideas to make the MIS the best space it can be!

committees.name: Internal Socials
committees.description: Fridays in the Quaddddd!!!!!!! This committee is perhaps the most active in promoting the week-to-week sense of community at McMurtry. Internals is mostly known for throwing the amazing FITQs (Fridays in the Quad) at Murt. Based on its theme, internals can collaborate (and have many times) with other committees to hold joint FITQs as well. We have also previously organized McMurtry outings such as McSkate and McFloat, and started events like Murti Gras, although those are up to discretion. You have free reign to create social events at the college and contribute to our amazing vibes!

committees.name: External Socials
committees.description: Y2K!! College Night!! External Socials plan events that feature Murts interacting with other colleges, including McMurtry's public party (Y2K!!), college nights, Pub night, and cross-college events. Our goal is to create activities that every Murt would love to participate in and to find ways to make sure every member of our college feels connected to the larger Rice community by simply doing FUN STUFF. We are always ready to hear any input that anyone might have, and we cannot wait to make this an amazing year!

committees.name: Beer Bike
committees.description: Beer Bike. Some say it's the best day of the year. Others say it's the best day of their lives (with the exception of the other Beer Bikes they were fortunate enough to attend). The Beer Bike Committee is in charge of making this momentous day a reality for all of McMurtry to enjoy. We plan the Willy Week events, the morning of Beer Bike, and coordinate with campuswide programming for the bike and chug teams. Whether it be assisting the Biking or Chugging Teams, organizing water balloon filling, or rounding people up for an epic jack on… Duncan (of course) – there is something for everyone (including new students) to do! Beer Bike can always use more help to make sure everything goes smoothly, so if you loved Beer Bike or want next year’s Beer Bike to go well, JOIN!!

committees.name: Seniors
committees.description: The senior committee is responsible for planning and hosting fun events for the senior class throughout the year. Various past events have included the champagne toast kickoff, wine and cheese tasting, off-campus bar hopping, senior tailgates, and other secret senior events. They’re trying to expand the number of non-alcoholic events, though, and to survey the senior class to tailor the events to what everyone wants. If you want to help ensure that all McMurtry seniors truly enjoy their last year with the college family, then join us! (Seniors only)

committees.name: Culturals
committees.description: The Culturals Committee is the go-to committee to help plan events that expose our fellow Murts to diverse cultures! A typical event that we put together is Restaurant Day, where we bring foods from various cultures and share it with the Murt community at large. For example, we might cater traditionally Ethiopian appetizers, a Chinese meal, and a Mexican dessert - the combinations are limitless! We also have a lot of cross-committee collaboration and might work with the East Asian Affinity Group, for example, to help organize our massive Lunar New Year celebrations, or put funding towards buying South Asian snacks during religious holidays. If learning about new cultures and sharing that interest with the Murt community through catered meals, celebrations, and more interests you, then join the Culturals Committee!

committees.name: Diversity
committees.description:
The Diversity committee is focused on ensuring that DEI (Diversity, Equity and Inclusion) is a top priority at McMurtry! This involves being a resource for all of Murt in case they have any DEI related concerns that they would like to see addressed (e.g. lack of inclusion of certain backgrounds in events, interpersonal issues related to DEI, etc.) We also plan events and initiatives that can expose more Murts to the importance of having mature discussions surrounding DEI related topics. This past year, we have done the following initiatives: created a linktree that gives Murts access to lists of DEI resources on and off campus as well as an optionally anonymous feedback form; created a bulletin board (posted near the entrance of Murt commons) where people can post DEI and cultural event flyers; created a DEI instagram where we will be posting information about DEI issues relevant to Rice students right now; and collaborated with affinity groups at Murt to host cultural events.

We plan on hosting more DEI-discussion based events in the near future, as well as increasing communication between the diversity committee and all of Murt through email announcements and reminders of any important upcoming DEI events or DEI-related resources. If you are passionate about increasing the importance of DEI at Murt, you should join this committee!
